cons: court process takes a long time
you might not get what you want - a judge makes the decision
can be more stressful for you and your children
may increase conflict between you and the other parent
heading: Going to court
information: The court process is different in [Scotland](https://www.mygov.scot/justice-law/courts-tribunals/) and [Northern Ireland](https://www.nidirect.gov.uk/articles/solicitors-and-courts).
lede: You’ll need to go to court if you’ve tried other suitable options and still can’t agree arrangements, or you’re worried about the welfare of you or your children.
pros: a decision is made in your child’s best interest
usp: You want a court to make a decision or you have concerns about domestic abuse or child abuse.
